verses.verse: The word<WH1697> that came to Jeremiah<WH3414> from the LORD<WH3068>, after<WH310> that Nebuzaradan<WH5018> the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> had let him go<WH7971> from Ramah<WH7414>, when he had taken<WH3947> him being bound<WH631> in chains<WH246> among<WH8432> all that were carried away captive<WH1546> of Jerusalem<WH3389> and Judah<WH3063>, which were carried away captive<WH1540> unto Babylon<WH894>. chains: or, manicles

And the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> took<WH3947> Jeremiah<WH3414>, and said<WH559> unto him, The LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath pronounced<WH1696> this evil<WH7451> upon this place<WH4725>.

Now the LORD<WH3068> hath brought<WH935> it, and done<WH6213> according as he hath said<WH1696>: because ye have sinned<WH2398> against the LORD<WH3068>, and have not obeyed<WH8085> his voice<WH6963>, therefore this thing<WH1697> is come upon you.

And now, behold, I loose<WH6605> thee this day<WH3117> from the chains<WH246> which were upon thine hand<WH3027>. If it seem good<WH2896> <WH5869> unto thee to come<WH935> with me into Babylon<WH894>, come<WH935>; and I will look well<WH7760> <WH5869> unto thee: but if it seem ill<WH7489> <WH5869> unto thee to come<WH935> with me into Babylon<WH894>, forbear<WH2308>: behold<WH7200>, all the land<WH776> is before<WH6440> thee: whither it seemeth<WH413> good<WH2896> and convenient<WH3477> <WH5869> for thee to go<WH3212>, thither go<WH3212>. were: or, are upon thine hand I will: Heb. I will set mine eye upon thee

Now while he was not yet gone back<WH7725>, he said, Go back<WH7725> also to Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> the son<WH1121> of Shaphan<WH8227>, whom the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> hath made governor<WH6485> over the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063>, and dwell<WH3427> with him among<WH8432> the people<WH5971>: or go<WH3212> wheresoever it seemeth convenient<WH3477> <WH5869> unto thee to go<WH3212>. So the captain<WH7227> of the guard<WH2876> gave<WH5414> him victuals<WH737> and a reward<WH4864>, and let him go<WH7971>.

Then went<WH935> Jeremiah<WH3414> unto Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> to Mizpah<WH4708>; and dwelt<WH3427> with him among<WH8432> the people<WH5971> that were left<WH7604> in the land<WH776>.

Now when all the captains<WH8269> of the forces<WH2428> which were in the fields<WH7704>, even they and their men<WH582>, heard<WH8085> that the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> had made Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> governor<WH6485> in the land<WH776>, and had committed<WH6485> unto him men<WH582>, and women<WH802>, and children<WH2945>, and of the poor<WH1803> of the land<WH776>, of them that were not carried away captive<WH1540> to Babylon<WH894>;

Then they came<WH935> to Gedaliah<WH1436> to Mizpah<WH4708>, even Ishmael<WH3458> the son<WH1121> of Nethaniah<WH5418>, and Johanan<WH3110> and Jonathan<WH3129> the sons<WH1121> of Kareah<WH7143>, and Seraiah<WH8304> the son<WH1121> of Tanhumeth<WH8576>, and the sons<WH1121> of Ephai<WH5778> the Netophathite<WH5200>, and Jezaniah<WH3153> the son<WH1121> of a Maachathite<WH4602>, they and their men<WH582>.

And Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> the son<WH1121> of Shaphan<WH8227> sware<WH7650> unto them and to their men<WH582>, saying<WH559>, Fear<WH3372> not to serve<WH5647> the Chaldeans<WH3778>: dwell in<WH3427> the land<WH776>, and serve<WH5647> the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>, and it shall be well<WH3190> with you.

As for me, behold, I will dwell<WH3427> at Mizpah<WH4709> to serve<WH5975> <WH6440> the Chaldeans<WH3778>, which will come<WH935> unto us: but ye, gather<WH622> ye wine<WH3196>, and summer fruits<WH7019>, and oil<WH8081>, and put<WH7760> them in your vessels<WH3627>, and dwell<WH3427> in your cities<WH5892> that ye have taken<WH8610>. to serve: Heb. to stand before

Likewise when all the Jews<WH3064> that were in Moab<WH4124>, and among the Ammonites<WH5983>, and in Edom<WH123>, and that were in all the countries<WH776>, heard<WH8085> that the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> had left<WH5414> a remnant<WH7611> of Judah<WH3063>, and that he had set<WH6485> over them Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> the son<WH1121> of Shaphan<WH8227>;

Even all the Jews<WH3064> returned out<WH7725> of all places<WH4725> whither they were driven<WH5080>, and came<WH935> to the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063>, to Gedaliah<WH1436>, unto Mizpah<WH4708>, and gathered<WH622> wine<WH3196> and summer fruits<WH7019> very<WH3966> much<WH7235>.
Moreover Johanan<WH3110> the son<WH1121> of Kareah<WH7143>, and all the captains<WH8269> of the forces<WH2428> that were in the fields<WH7704>, came<WH935> to Gedaliah<WH1436> to Mizpah<WH4708>,

And said<WH559> unto him, Dost thou certainly<WH3045> know<WH3045> that Baalis<WH1185> the king<WH4428> of the Ammonites<WH1121> <WH5983> hath sent<WH7971> Ishmael<WH3458> the son<WH1121> of Nethaniah<WH5418> to slay<WH5221> <WH5315> thee? But Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> believed<WH539> them not. to slay: Heb. to strike thee in soul?

Then Johanan<WH3110> the son<WH1121> of Kareah<WH7143> spake<WH559> to Gedaliah<WH1436> in Mizpah<WH4709> secretly<WH5643>, saying<WH559>, Let me go<WH3212>, I pray thee, and I will slay<WH5221> Ishmael<WH3458> the son<WH1121> of Nethaniah<WH5418>, and no man<WH376> shall know<WH3045> it: wherefore should he slay<WH5221> <WH5315> thee, that all the Jews<WH3064> which are gathered<WH6908> unto thee should be scattered<WH6327>, and the remnant<WH7611> in Judah<WH3063> perish<WH6>?

But Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Ahikam<WH296> said<WH559> unto Johanan<WH3110> the son<WH1121> of Kareah<WH7143>, Thou shalt not do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>: for thou speakest<WH1696> falsely<WH8267> of Ishmael<WH3458>.
